lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMQ suK cwhq skl pMQ skl drs gur drs ADIn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Pand Soukh Chaahat Sakal Panda , Sakal Daras Gur Daras Adheen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: All religions yearn for the comfort and peace of the path of Guru-conscious people. All cults and religions are subservient and in attendance to the path of Guru

lines.gurmukhi: sur sursir gur crn srn cwhY byd bHmwidk sbd ilv lIn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sur Surasari Gur Charan Saran Chaahai , Bayd Brahamaadik Sabad Liv Leen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: All gods and their holy rivers yearn for the refuge of Satguru Ji. Brahma the creator of Vedas also longs to attach his mind in the words of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: srb igAwin guru igAwn Avgwhn mY srb inDwn gur kiRpw jl mIn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sarab Giaani Guru Giaan Avagaahan Mai , Sarab Nidhaan Gur Kripaa Jal Meen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: All the religions are seekers of the Naam Simran. By the blessings of the Guru, one gets all the treasures of the world just as a fish receives life-supporting water.

lines.gurmukhi: jogI jog jugiq mY BogI Bog Bugiq mY gurmuiK inj pd kul AkulIn hY ]58]
lines.transliteration_english: Jogee Jog Jougati Mai Bhogee Bhog Bhougati Mai , Gurmukhi Nij Pad Kul Akuleen Hai ?58?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the Yogis are perpetually immersed in practicing yogic exercises and a worldly man is ever engrossed in enjoying the relishments, similarly the devoted Sikhs remain engrossed in the higher spiritual state through Naam Simran and keep themselves un
